meanings.definition: A small container, typically cylindrical and made of glass, used to hold liquids.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully poured the blue liquid into the vial.
meanings.sent2: She stored the perfume in a beautiful vial on her dresser.
meanings.sent3: The tiny fairy in the story lived inside a magical vial.
meanings.sent4: His tears seemed to fill up an invisible vial of sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The vial sparkled under the sunlight, showcasing its delicate design.

meanings.definition: To put into or as if into a vial.
meanings.sent1: He would vial the potion with precision, measuring each drop.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist would vial the medicine for the patient.
meanings.sent3: She decided to vial her memories in a special jar to keep them safe.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to vial her heart, sealing it with love.
meanings.sent5: The artist vialled his emotions into each brushstroke, creating a masterpiece.
